item.title: Y'all showed OUT on #COGivesDay with an unbelievable...
item.content:encoded:
Black Lives Matter 5280

Y'all showed OUT on #COGivesDay with an unbelievable $51,000 in donations! Yes- FIFTY-ONE THOUSAND DOLLARS, making it our biggest CO Gives Day ever, surpassing our goal by 255% (üò≥üò≥üò≥). We are so grateful and humbled, but most of all we are so excited for the work your generosity enables us to do. THIS IS WHAT COMMUNITY LOOKS LIKE! üñ§
Not Pictured: Ari, Sal, Keezy, and Diana - all of whom are in our hearts and are integral to every inch of this work.

#MutualAid

Mutual Aid Denver

UPDATE: this was a time-sensitive opportunity. The volunteers at the food bank were giving food boxes away until they were gone, so there aren't any more availa...ble. However! The Church in the City food pantry is open every Thursday on 16th between Gaylord and York!
FREE FOOD BOXES! On 16th between Gaylord and York! The food pantry this food usually goes to didn't work out today, so there's A LOT that needs to be distributed and taken! There's potatoes, onions, apples, yogurt, cheese, cottage cheese, milk!

item.title: Image Description: BLM5280 letterhead featuring our Denver...
item.content:encoded:
Black Lives Matter 5280

Image Description:
BLM5280 letterhead featuring our Denver skyline logo with black text on an offehite background reads:

RE: The Office of Independent Monitor George Floyd Protest Report

...

December 8, 2020

Upon reviewing the Office of the Independent Monitor's report analyzing the Denver Police Department‚Äôs (DPD) response to the 2020 protests, most of the findings are no surprise to us. Since we organized the May 28th protest, we have condemned their use of military grade munitions on protestors in the Denver and Aurora communities. The report highlights a number of policy and civil rights violations against protestors, including use of force and excessive force complaints, lack of record keeping when using force, the lack of dispersal orders, and disabling body worn cameras. These violations are the very ones that protestors were protesting against.

Our own chapter members and community members shared stories about exposure to chemical weapons, resulting in both physical and emotional harm. Our chapter diverted crisis funds to community to aid injured protestors in getting adequate care for their physical injuries and receiving financial support for mental health care and healing. At Today's DPD press conference there was no discussion of how DPD or the City of Denver will repair harm to those who were emotionally and/or physically injured by DPD, including the multiple individuals who lost their eyes. Again, our ACLU federal lawsuit is under review at this time, which aims to hold the city accountable for First Amendment violations against protestors.

BLM5280 will continue to engage in direct actions holding DPD accountable for the mistreatment of Black people, as we have been doing since 2015. We will continue to hold appointed officials accountable, including the Denver City Council who supported the 2021-2022 DPD budget despite community members expressing these concerns throughout the summer. BLM statements are meaningless without legislative changes to protect community. We will continue to demand justice for Elijah McClain and countless others in our community and their families who have yet to receive justice. Lastly, we support the recommendations enumerated in the OIM's report in order to increase accountability from DPD. In sum, the OIM report only highlights what we've already known and we will continue our work


It is our duty to fight for our freedom.
It is our duty to win.
Black Lives Matter 5280

See More
item.author: Black Lives Matter 5280

item.title: #CALLTOACTION We are infuriated. In the midst of an uprising of global proportions fueled by the worldwide demanding of...
item.content:encoded:
#CALLTOACTION We are infuriated. In the midst of an uprising of global proportions fueled by the worldwide demanding of #justiceforBlacklives, the justice system is still being weaponized against us in real time. With the entire world hyper-focused on racial injustice white supremacists have doubled down in full confidence that they will be protected by the justice department above all else. Boulder DA's Office, 20th Judicial District - DA Michael Dougherty is functioning as a vehicle of white supremacy in his refusal to drop these trumped up charges against this sister after years of enduring vile behaviors like the use of racial slurs against her children. We are in fierce support of Mrs. Jeweldine Kastman and her family, and we demand a full dismissal of all charges against them. Call Da Dougherty’s office and demand he dismiss this case today and everyday until it is done! (720) 470-7871
Boulder County case number 19CR1876
#DefundPolice #DefendBlackLife #AbolishthePolice #AbolitionNOW #BlackLivesMatter #BLM5280 #solidarity
Boulder DA's Office, 20th Judicial District - DA Michael Dougherty

[Image Description: BLM5280 letterhead featuring the BLM5280 skyline logo on a white background with a deep grey border reading the following:
November 11 2020
We, the members of Black Lives Matter 5280, after careful consideration of Mrs. Jeweldine Kastman’s case, believe she has been the victim of prejudice in the criminal justice system. Our core values demand we take personal responsibility for denouncing the kind of discrimination, harassment, and racism Mrs. Kastman has experienced in Boulder County. Further, we believe the District Attorney has a responsibility to the public to reexamine her case through an unbiased lens. We believe that acknowledgment and reconsideration of the implicit biases in this case should lead to the conclusion that the interests of justice require that Mrs. Kastman's case be dismissed.
Mrs. Kastman moved to Colorado just a couple of years ago having never experienced the kind of blatant racism she would encounter from her neighbors here. cont. in comments]
item.author: Black Lives Matter 5280

item.title: Many have asked about where to donate. We have shared and will...
item.content:encoded:
Black Lives Matter 5280

Many have asked about where to donate. We have shared and will continue to share links to bail/legal support fundraising in Denver, Minneapolis and beyond. We encourage friends to donate to BLM5280‚Äôs Emergency Fund using Venmo http://venmo.com/BLM5280 . These donations will be used for bail, legal support, and provision of direct services for Black people impacted by the current and ongoing crisis. If you would like to make a tax-deductible donation that we will have access to at a later date, you can visit our Colorado Gives Day Page to donate through our fiscal sponsor, Rocky Mountain Peace and Justice Center.

Working with residents and organizations in Denver, Black Lives Matter 5280 assists in building more loving and united Black communities while eliminating anti-Black violence and racism. To expose, address and eradicate structures and systems of oppression in Denver, BLM5280 uses a holistic racial j...
